title.narrative: OUTPUT 1. [PREVENTION & RESPONSE SERVICES TO VIOLENCE AGAINST CHILDREN]

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, functional services for prevention and response to violence against children are available in the program priority areas, with a focus on zones affected by humanitarian situations., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Child Protection]: By 2019, children, especially girls, are better protected against violence, abuse and exploitation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, functional services for prevention and response to violence against children are available in the programpriority areas, with a focus on zones affected by humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF in Mali improved the delivery of immediate care and protection services by developing new partnerships, strengthening community-based networks, supporting outreach interventions in remote areas and piloting innovative strategies, in both humanitarian and development contexts. In 2019, UNICEF provided gender-based violence response services to 293 women and girls in humanitarian situations, a significant increase compared to the 73 women and girls reached in 2018. In 2019, a key achievement was the provision of psychosocial support to 53,367 vulnerable children and provision of holistic care to 723 unaccompanied or separated children and 249 children associated with armed forces and groups. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:06/02/2020
